title: [FR] Display actual timestamp for "Start Time" column in runs table of experiment page UI

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body: ## Proposal Summary [FR] Display actual timestamp (e.g. 2021-08-30 23:12:34) instead of "1 days ago" for the "Start Time" column in runs table of experiment page UI ## Motivation - It is very difficult to distinguish multiple runs of one day when the "Start Time" is always "1 days ago". - There is no unique identifier (primary key) for runs in this page since the run ID is not displayed in the table. - In the absence of a run ID, "Start Time" is the best proxy for a unique identifier. - Therefore the actual timestamp should be displayed instead of vague "1 days ago". - Actual timestamp is also needed for model governance and regulatory environments. ### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect? Components - [ x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging Interfaces - [x ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
